title: (10600) Plasencia - 43 Avenida del Valle

Restaurants and bathing area around. Escalators to go up to the city center in less than 5 min. Good communication.

title: (10600) Plasencia -

title: (10600) Plasencia - 173 Urbanización Valle del Jerte
description: Small flat car park extended by a tarmac path authorized on foot and by bicycle, which circumvents the lake. the parking lot can accommodate 3 motorhomes. popular place for locals who come for a walk every evening from 6 to 8 p.m. the view is beautiful. very quiet night.

title: (10600) Plasencia -
description: Idyllic place to spend a night or more! at the edge of a lake to cool off, swim etc... place a bit windy, choose your place under an olive tree to be in the shade, beautiful place, people walk their dogs and are nice!

title: (10600) Plasencia - Unnamed Road
description: Perfect place to spend a couple of days. Beautiful and very quiet. A few meters, picnic area with tables and a few steps from the Jerte River.

title: (10600) Plasencia - Unnamed Road

title: (10600) Plasencia - Unnamed Road
description: Superb spots .... Shaded for small vehicles because low branches ... Bathing .... Bulls in freedom ........ Barbecues made available but attention all the same to the strong possibilities of fire.

title: (10697) Malpartida de Plasencia - CC-18.2

And unfortunately also a lot of waste, as if the weekend was a party.

title: (10680) Malpartida de Plasencia - EX-108

title: (10697) Malpartida de Plasencia - CC-18.1
description: Quiet place next to a lake ideal for a night.

title: (10680) Malpartida de Plasencia - CC-18.3
description: A quiet place by the road with little traffic, for a meal stop or an overnight stay.

title: (10680) Malpartida de Plasencia - 4 EX-208
description: Restaurant near Parc Monfragüe. The owner loves motorhomes. No problem for the night. He is a big fan of his country and will inform you about everything there is to see around. And for meals it is plentiful!

name: Camping Parc de Monfragüe
title: (10680) Camping Parc de Monfragüe
description: Camping Park Monfragüe. Carretera Plasencia-Trujillo is 9 km away. The Parque Nacional de Monfrague and the visitor’s centre is 50 metyers from the camping. The wifi is for free but only works in or next to the restaurant. Limited capacity due to provider availability.

title: (10670) Carcaboso - EX-370
description: Old picknick area with Stone tables and benches, trees for shade. no signs saying you can not sleep here. descent and turn are a bit tight for big motorhomes, best avoid

title: (10671) Pradochano - 2 Calle Pradochano-Perdiz
description: Nice place with free pool. The pool is open all summer from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. Although it states that it is not suitable for bathing, it is only because the water is not treated, but since it comes from the mountains it is good. They are looking at how to solve the ban, I hope they will reopen it soon.

title: (10680) Malpartida de Plasencia - CCV-116
description:
Old Malpartida de Plasencia train station. The access in the last section is a little more complicated but it is easy to reach. At the station there is a greenway for cyclists, we did a stretch from there.
No services but a super quiet place.
Keep it clean.

title: (10616) Cáceres -
description: Wonderful place next to Lake Plasencia. There is no shade in this area. In the afternoon cars drive by to kayak or paddle surf in the reservoir, but in the morning we were alone with some fisherman in the distance. There are nearby houses, in one of them they raise chickens and the lady approached the AC to offer fresh eggs.

title: (10616) Casas del Castañar - N-110
description: Magnificent picnic area. We found two large trees that gave us 5m of shade to park the car and enjoy a wonderful meal with a swim by the lake. You can come here with a long van and there is enough room to turn around.

title: (10720) Villar de Plasencia - 454 N-630
description: Gravelled area to side of the services. Away from main noise of the road. Trucks do pull in and out but everyone respectful when we stayed there overnight. Toilets in the fuel service building

title: (10616) Casas del Castañar - N-110
description: All free. This is an esplanade in front of the Regino restaurants, is very nice and if you consume something you have access to the bathroom and the WIFI code that reaches the esplanade, that's fine, all the food is typical of Extremadura.

title: (10680) Malpartida de Plasencia - EX-208
description: Quiet spot, surrounded by nature. Very nice view to the mountain top far away. There's the occasional car passing by (it's on a side road that leads to a hotel) and it's also close to the main road, although there's so little traffic you couldnt tell. It's conveniently close to Monfrague natural park. Overnight NOT allowed!

title: (10720) Villar de Plasencia - CC-94
description: Villar de Plasencia swimming pool car parks. They are next to a local road but without traffic at night. A very cool place the climb to Cabezabellosa.

title: (10729) Cabezabellosa - 10 Calle la Amargura

If you find someone in front can be complicated, viewpoint of the impressive castle hermitage hanging from the abyss, nearby routes between chestnut and oak trees, many fountains in the village

title: (10729) Cabezabellosa - CC-94

title: (10617) El Torno - CC-51

title: (10617) El Torno - CC-51
description:
Parking viewpoint historical memory.

It is not finished yet but there is a large esplanade and today (Holy Tuesday morning) there is no one working.
Great esplanade, lots of space and beautiful views.

title: (10691) Galisteo - Unnamed Road

title: (10617) El Torno - 5 Carretera Cabezabellosa

title: (10617) Rebollar - Unnamed Road

Direct road access and 5000 meters for you to choose where to set up, with oaks and cork oaks. You can even take home a basket of organic vegetables from our beautiful garden.  PLEASE NOTE THAT IT IS NECESSSARY TO TELEPHONE IN ADVANCE

title: (10710) Zarza de Granadilla - 106 Carretera Guijo

Free parking at the municipal swimming pool of the town.

The terrain is flat and it is very quiet for sleeping.

The site has a restaurant where they treated us in an incredible way and with incredible value for money.

We had only planned to spend a day there, but after visiting Granadilla and seeing the Roman ruins of Caparra, we returned to sleep on the site.

We will be back in the summer to enjoy the pool.

title: (10712) Guijo de Granadilla - Unnamed Road
description: Parking in front of the moor, view unbeatable, downside: that there is no shade. Solution: wake up early and cool in the water.

title: (10530) Serradilla -

title: (10665) Guijo de Granadilla - Unnamed Road

title: (10530) Serradilla -

We spent two very quiet nights, there are a couple of stone tables next to it to eat, and it is very close to the viewpoint and the gorge of the friar. IMPORTANT To avoid going through the gate, it is better to go along the cemetery road. We with an L3H2 passed without problems. There is a small descent, which is carefully passed. Perhaps somewhat complicated for motorhomes.

name: Camping Bungalow Valle del Jerte
title: (10612) Camping Bungalow Valle del Jerte
description: Campsite next to the Jerte river. Very close to the Hell's Throat. Many routes to visit the Jerte valley. Expensive for what it offers. Lots of shade, as it has very tall trees. This is a problem for large motorhomes. Be careful not to rub the branches during maneuvers. Good pool with grass. It is in a privileged environment a few meters from the Garganta de los Infierno. The discharge area has only one faucet which should be used to charge the water and clean the toilet

(tourist office ... they speak in English,)

title: (37724) Lagunilla - C. Emigrante
